thread.title: New York Stock Exchange suspended after tech glitch, markets worried | Business News | Business and Finance News |
thread.title_full: New York Stock Exchange suspended after tech glitch, markets worried | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Kevin Dugan
title: New York Stock Exchange suspended after tech glitch, markets worried | Business News | Business and Finance News |
text:
THE New York Stock Exchange halted trading on all stocks this morning because of a technical problem, the company said, further roiling markets when stock values were falling over news from China and Europe.
The New York Post reports that the halt, which started at 11:32am (1:32am AEST), occurred on a “heavy volume day,” and could have a broad impact on markets if the exchange stays down for several hours, said Randy Frederick, a managing director at Charles Schwab, said.
Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange in New York prior to a computer glitch. Picture: AP Source: AP
After the NYSE halted stocks, the Wall Street Journal homepage was also down for unconfirmed reasons.
Stock trading continued on other exchanges and “dark pools,” with the Dow down 1.3 per cent by noon at 17,548.95.
The New York Stock Exchange said the halt was “not the result of a cyber breach.”
Life goes on outside ... People walk by the New York Stock Exchange in New York. Picture: AFP Source: AFP
Originally published as Glitch halts New York Stock Exchange
